intro: Hieracium chrysocephalum, commonly known as the golden-centred hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, giving it a striking appearance. It typically grows in grassy areas and is often found in disturbed soils. Hieracium chrysocephalum is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters.
